newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends down on funds in active spreading.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends down on funds in active spreading.

text.p: WCE canola ended at the day's lows on fund selling in active spreading, traders said.
"Funds sold 500 to 1,000 July, people noticed the crush numbers an hour after they came out and it firmed up the spreads. There was 700 July-Nov and 700 July-Aug traded," a trader said.

The Canadian Oilseed Processors' Association set the past week's canola crush level at 61,268 tonnes, up 11 percent from the prior week which was also bullish. July WCE futures crush margin rose to -0.26 Friday from -0.76 Thursday. July-Nov spread from $26 to $24, July-Aug $1, Sep-Nov $3.50. Volume was 76,000 lots, or 152,000 tonnes.
Japan bought 5,000-6,000 tonnes overnight, sources said.

July canola fell $5.40 to $402.70, November down $4.60 to $377.30. July flax up $0.90 to $333.90 as Midland Walwyn sold to commercials, November down $0.40 to $322. Twenty five Sep Nov flax spread at $3.
"There was commercial buying of July flax anticipating export business," a trader said.
July western barley fell $1 at $135.50 on commercial and hedge selling, October lost $0.90 to $135.60 as commercials bought. July-Oct spread at $0.10. Volume was 800 lots.
RBC sold 25 October peas down US$1.50 at US$186 to PCTS.

July feed wheat lost $0.90 to $159.10, Cargill sold December down $1.80 to $160 while locals were scale down buyers of March down $2 to $163, traders said. About 165 Dec Mar spread at $3. Volume was 605 lots. Oats did not trade.
(All prices in Canadian dollars/tonne except oats, peas).
